title: Konkomba (1997) Genesis Portion
description: Konkomba is a Gurma language spoken in Ghana, Togo and Burkina Faso. The Konkomba language, known natively as Likpakpaln, is spoken by the Konkomba people, who are also known as the Bikpakpaam. The Konkomba language has several dialects, including, but not limited to, Lichaboil, Ligbeln, Likoonli, Limonkpeln and Linafeel.
provider: Ghana: Ghana Institute of Linguistics, Literacy & Bible Translation
